review_description: This is a decent skill to enable for Echo. Upon opening up you can ask Echo to list the sounds however she reads them so fast it can be difficult to keep track. I've compiled that full list below as of March 17, 2017. This skill needs some work as once you open it you need to issue it the direct name of the sound you want immediately it asks "What can I do for you?". Otherwise it will look for a band by that name to shuffle music for. It also does not really have the capability to switch between sounds, you will need to tell Echo to open sleep sounds each time and name the sound you wish to switch to.
List of Sounds:
Beautiful Dream - Electronic piano music, soft, slow and slightly sad. Personally I enjoyed this sound.
Brown Noise - Sounds like you're sitting next to an industrial intake fan
City Rain - Moderate steady rain with slight drips on pavement
Heartbeat - Plays a heartbeat at approximately 80 bpm with slight tempo variations
Heavy Rain - Sounds more like loud static white noise
Jungle Night - Crickets, birds, insects, and some other wild animals. One of my favorites.
Mountain Lake - Lapping water that sounds like waves from the wake of a boat. Cuts in and out.
Ocean - Moderate wave sounds, slight white noise quality to background
Rain - Sounds like 'City Rain'
Relax -
River
Sleep Little Babies
Small Lake
Swish Massage
Thunderstorm
White Noise
Wind Chimes
Rainforest
Fireplace - Fast fireplace crackle, short loop that cuts in and out.
Underwater
Wind
Music Box
Forest Birds

It used to be I could open this wonderful little app and get the sound I wanted. No fuss, no muss, all worked fine. Now, when I open it, I must sit through a long-winded sales pitch trying to get me to upgrade to a premium version. In addition, it sometimes provided a long-winded plea (with step-by-step-by-step-by-step.... instructions) telling me how to give it a 5 star review.  If you're willing to sit through all these sales pitches, you might find this app to be useful. If you are simply looking for the sounds (like it used to play without an upfront sales pitch), then you might want to rethink it.  DEVELOPERS:  Drop the B.S. upfront and I'll re-review this app. Otherwise, it's become an annoying waste of time when I'm looking for peaceful sounds.
OK, already!!!  I give up. Let's see if this 5-star rating (as ORDERED by the app developers) will actually remove the relentless sales pitches.

Add me to the list of those people who paid $19.95 for the lifetime premium membership, back at the beginning of October, only to have it mysteriously disappear a couple months later. I contacted sleep sounds support (support@sleepsounds.io) and they opened a ticket for me a few days ago. As with others here, I have heard nothing back from them yet.
I really enjoyed sleep sounds, and was happy to pay the premium to get a sound that I liked that was not included with the basic sounds. But if I pay, I expect to get the service.

UPDATE TO ORIGINAL COMMENT: Finally got a response to my ticket, months later, and now I can again access my premium sounds so I am changing the stars from 1 to 4. No 5 star as the company was so unresponsive for months, but it is a good app.

So I have been enjoying this app and it has helped me get more restful sleep.  I was a little miffed when suddenly they decided to put most of their content behind a paywall.  It even says the original content would be free to the original users but nevertheless I get the message that the sound I have been listening to for weeks is now premium only.  Well I decide the promotional lifetime membership is worth it so I shell out the fifteen bucks and follow the instructions to register.  But then nothing happened.  I'm out $15 and don't even get what I paid for!  Used to be a good app and would even be worth the money, but as is it is a total rip off.  Will be emailing the developer for a refund.  If that doesn't work I'll be complaining to Amazon as it reflects poorly on them as well.  Don't pay for this service until you are sure it will work!
At first it was a wonderful skill and a great aid for sleep.
Then ads started popping up at the beginning, moderately annoying but tolerable.
Now all but their most basic sounds require a premium membership.
LAME!
Opening this skill now gives a promotional message about their new paid subscription plan, which is now required to get access to some sounds which were originally free. Disabling skill.

This is a great app that is useful for sleep, but also for background sounds when studying, writing, or reading. Really you can use it for anything. I've had the birds playing while cleaning the house instead of music. It's a nice change. If you want to use the timer function, try saying "end" instead of "stop" like the instructions say. For example, once it's playing, say, "Alexa, end in 30 minutes." Echo will reply with something along the lines of a sleep timer set for 30 minutes.

I've been using this skill religiously every night for the past 4 months to get my baby to sleep (the 'car ride' sound usually works like a charm) but it suddenly stopped working last night. Please fix this ASAP! Was a 5 🌟 skill until it stopped working!
i have listened to this every night for over a year. Now it is asking me to ungrade to premium and when i say no I get nothing.

Well-Made Skill That Does As Advertised!

Non-existent Support for People Who Paid for Premium

review_description: You asked me to leave you a review, so here I am. When I invoke sleep sounds, I am putting my child to bed. I walk into their room, ask Alexa to open sleep sounds and I want it to immediately start. Instead I am interrupted with a message to leave a review or a message about new features. I do not want this. Ever. Just start and never play any audio I do not ask for. Please.

I CANNOT sleep without a fan. Mine broke the other night and I had the worst time falling and staying asleep. With my work schedule I wouldn't be able to get a new fan for a few days, and I can't go that long without a good nights sleep! My boyfriend suggested having Alexa play beach noises, to which I begrudgingly agreed (I'm picky about my pre sleep white noise, okay?!).

Once I downloaded the skill, Alexa offered to go through the full FORTY list of sounds! 40!! And it's not your typical sappy nature noises. I was over the moon when she mentioned oscillating fan. It was super relaxing, and the way the sound fades in and out it actually sounds like a natural fan sweeping back and forth. I woke up at one point in the morning actually expecting to feel a cool breeze on my face as Alexa imitated the sound of a fan turning in my direction.

I will still be picking up a fan as we're mid summer and I need something to move air around my room at night. However this will be great come winter when I need white noise but don't need something adding chill to the air.
Was a good app but now I have to listen to Alexa speak a commercial for 2 minutes.  If you are going to add commercials, at least make them less painful by recording with a voice actor.

The sound loops are done seamlessly on this skill, and the sounds are very relaxing.  They work well to calm a busy mind that is supposed to be going to sleep but can't. I've listened to a lot of sleep sound programs over the years because I like them for relaxation, so I know the difference between those that induce relaxation and those that are inadvertently "too busy", or which aren't looped smoothly, and become annoying instead. This skill is one of the good ones and I recommend it.
I have been a premium member since the beginning and now all of a sudden the app doesn’t recognize this. All of my custom sounds are gone... what a horrible app. Waste of $19.95...

The thunderstorm sounds are so life like I can almost feel my house shake with thunder. I only have playing on simple small satellite speakers. This is by far my greatest skill yet for my Alexa. This is what I have needed in my sleep life

Back when they offered a premium upgrade for $15, I bought it for the additional and higher quality sounds. When we were no longer hearing those sounds, I reached out for support. I received nothing but automated responses. No human contacted me after the multiple inquiries. Their premium page is no longer prominently displayed on their home page. I can only assume that's because they no longer offer it. That's not helping those of us who paid for the premium features.
After searching for answers, I found them. But for paying 15 bucks for premium sounds and support, I only still have the former...allegedly.
They should either refund my money or stop bugging me to leave a 5 star review. The company doesn't stand behind their product and, therefore, doesn't deserve it.

I'm a new dad with twin infants and this skill was initially amazing for getting them to quiet down during feeding times. It was pretty simple: "Open Sleep Sounds", "Play [Whatever I felt like in the moment.]

But lately, there's about a 1 in 3 chance I will say "Open Sleep Sounds" and will be greeted with a five to ten minute monologue about new features (that doesn't actually enhance the experience I was already receiving), a tutorial on how to use a skill I've already been a steady or loyal user for several months, or (infuriatingly) a request that I navigate to this page to rate Sleep Sounds. Well, the coincidence of this request in the context of me trying to sooth a teething infant while Alexa's voice waking up the other twin is exactly what motivated me.

The Sleep Sounds skill's competitors aren't just other white noise skills on the Alexa, but playlists I could easily generate from Spotify or Amazon Music. Or a cheap noise generator. Or a radio tuned in between stations. Or even a box fan or hair dryer. So it's a case of constantly attempting to "improve" the product actually gets in the way of the usefulness of the product when it's just as easy for me to never invoke it all if it doesn't work as expected.

Perhaps if Invoked Apps did more to engage their users OUTSIDE of the Alexa... such as through social media or reaching out through Amazon's registered users, instead of making me wade through an interaction to actually get to the use case I want from it (basically... static).

I have disabled the skill on Alexa and instead ordered a white noise machine for the living room. Is it hands free like the Sleep Sounds skill? No. Does it work basically the same way every time and doesn't blast me with product updates at 4 AM when I'm half asleep and my kids are fussy? No. And that alone makes it worth the money.

Initially liked this skill, well enough to have gotten the premium membership, but it has been very lousy and pretty much unusable of late.  Initially, only issue seemed to be with playback of sounds randomly stopping.  Then it started to repeatedly "forget" my registration as a premium member.  Relinked my account several times, but skill would not retain the link more than a day and each time I would lose my custom sounds.  Tried contacting the developer, but they have failed to respond so I have requested a refund.  Will be looking for other solutions.

I loved the app and paid for the premium membership which was fantastic-until one day I started getting the message that I had to be a premium member to use what I was wanting to listen to. I AM a premium member. I have tried to contact the seller, but have had no response at all from them. I am very disappointed because until that time I was using it every single night.

Like this app, bought the lifetime full version, then weeks later it is back to the base version and there is nowhere to login or get a refund for what I paid. No trace of the purchase except for a charge on my card.
Poor place to put a loud and lengtby ad. This is supposed to be a relaxing skill. Can no longer use this skill.
UPDATED REVIEW:

In my previous review, I wrote that "I deleted it" because it was "limited in what you can have played." But since then, I received feedback from the developer(s). Basically, the developer stated that there are many sounds to try and that the app is not limited. So I downloaded the app again and gave it another try. This is my second opinion of the app.

Yes, there are many different sleep sounds, but most of them are not free. However, I believe that a free Sample of the sounds are available for purchase because today, when I downloaded the app again, I was able to hear some sounds that are not free.

Another problem that I've encountered is that when I asked the Echo device to change to another sound, she misunderstood my request and began to play a song from the Amazon music library (or store, since I do not have a music library with Amazon). In this case, I had to ask the Echo device to stop, and then ask the Echo device to go back to the Sleep and Relaxation Sounds app and start over again. I'm not sure what I was doing wrong, if anything.
The bottom line is the app is good, but if you want more sounds than the app has to offer for free, you have to purchase them. I hope this updated review is helpful. Thank you.

It's a Great skill. However when it wakes my baby up from our bedroom because Alexa decides to give us a speal about "thanks for playing this skill, please rate it in the skills setting of the Alexa app. now please enjoy Sleep and relaxation sounds" at volume 5 from earlier in the day. Alexa should automatically have a quiet time built in, or something you can set. Where all devices go mute and don't talk back for reviews and other things like it.
it stopped working please help i need it back

The basic product is fine, although the sound you want is often prefaced with a hard-sell infomercial. Avoid the Premium membership until they have their act together. No directions or list of services offered, and widely varying and inconsistent prices. At present you can get a lifetime membership for $19.95, a monthly membership at an unspecified price, or an annual membership for $9.95 or $8. In any case, it is not clear what a premium membership entails. For example, a blurb on the web site touts famous short stories, but there is no listing for them. I signed up for their email list to get extra sounds, but so far haven't heard from them.

I used to love this skill to absolute pieces and couldn't sleep without my favorite sound...until they moved it behind a paywall. Luckily I can get a similar sound on a different app. Not worth it to pay money for this app.

review_description: New version limits amount of sounds, and makes you pay for sounds that were previously free. Users should be allowed to have access to what they've always had. Poor business practice.
Love Sleep Sounds. I'm one of those people who can't sleep if it's too quiet. I'll either have a fan on or some kind of white noise.
Trying "crickets" right now. I was born and raised in the Midwest, and the sounds of crickets at night would lull me to sleep.  Now I'm in the desert, and there are no cricket sounds outside.
Listening to the cricket sleep sounds makes me feel like I'm back home again!
My youngest daughter, who has severe autism, also likes the "rain" sound. Whenever she comes to visit me at my house, she'll ask for the rain sounds. It helps with her auditory processing.
Can't wait to explore more of the Sleep Sounds!
Oh.... there is no noticeable "loop" in the sounds, either. Some sound machines you can hear where certain sounds or frequencies repeat. I haven't noticed that with Sleep Sounds.

My wife and I love this skill, but it has been completely ruined by the repeated interruptions practically begging for a 5 star review. What’s worse is that this happens right when we are in bed, just wanting to go to sleep. Congratulations, you finally got the review you kept asking for.
This is a shinning example of how not to get positive reviews in the App Store.
Loved it.... until it forgot I was a paid premium member.  Paid the $19.95, started saving custom configurations
(Like ocean with thunderstorm) and for two weeks it worked.  Now it forgot I am a lifetime member.  Still has my money!

Let me start by saying that the app publisher knows I’m posting this. I logged a complaint with them over two weeks ago. After no response for a few days, I sent another message letting them know that I would really rather resolve the issue, but if I didn’t hear back from them in another few days, I would post my experience. After the second message, an actual support ticket was issued but no response has been given, and I gave them a full week longer than what I said I would. So, here is the scoop on these guys.
I first started using the free version of this skill and it was great. I’d tell Alexa to play some ocean sounds and it would play really high quality ocean sounds all night.

Then I decided to buy the premium membership. Getting the skill to actually recognize that I paid for premium was really hard. I had to contact their support email and, to their credit at that time, they got me fixed pretty quickly. The premium purchase was worth it! I was able to compile a custom sound that was perfect for our sleepy comfort.
About a week later, the thing became my enemy.

One night when I told it to play our sleep sound, right as we nestled in to sleep, we were treated to a long-winded Alexa-voiced plea for a good rating in the App Store. A sleep sound app should play sleep sounds, not yell at me in a computer voice for ratings. ESPECIALLY after I paid way more for a premium membership on an app than I’d usually pay.

About a week after that, the app suddenly stopped playing through the night. It would play for about an hour then stop. My wife and our dogs are all light sleepers and good white noise helps them stay asleep. The whole reason I paid for this app is to play sounds all night long; since it doesn’t anymore, I’ve stopped using it. That’s when i contacted support again...over two weeks later I haven’t received a reply despite multiple attempts. I gather from other reviews that this was an issue caused by a change in the Echo ecosystem, but some reviewers have indicated that the app developer supplied them with a fix or workaround. The fact that I paid for a premium membership and have received no communication on how to resolve a fundamental issue with their app isn’t acceptable to me. I am providing this review as a preview to others on the type of service you can expect after buying a premium membership.

If I were you, I would just find a couple long duration white noise tracks you like on Amazon Music, put them in a playlist, and tell Alexa to loop that playlist when you’re ready for bed. That’s what I’ve done and it works better than this app does in its current state.

I paid for the premium membership after only a few days using Sleep Sounds. I found the list of sounds impressive and combining sounds was cool. Last night, after returning from a very stressful trip, I discovered that the premium membership features have been stripped away. The list of sounds has been dramatically reduced and you can not combine sounds (their website says you can). I've send customer support a message, but don't expect to hear back.
Going to disable this skill as soon as I find a replacement.

review_description: I've used this app for over a month to help me sleep and it has been wonderful until last night. The sound is now stopping after less than an hour and needs to be manually resumed for it to continue. I must have done that a half a dozen times last night. I disabled and re-enabled the app and that didn't help. I'm not sure what changed but obviously in my case I can't use it like this. Prior to this issue, the sound would fade out after about an hour and fade back in a few seconds. That wasn't bad because it wasn't distractful. But, now it just stops.

UPDATE a couple of days later-

Received a comment from them asking me to email them.  The email was a different one than on their site.  So I now have 3 different emails for support and have yet to receive a response from any of them.  It did start working again for a couple of days - except my customs never came back - and then last night it woke me up a little after midnight with a pitch on how I would have to purchase a membership to continue to use. "Would you like to purchase this?"  I said yes thinking I would handle it this morning.  It charge my account $8 and then - STILL WOULD NOT PLAY!  "You have to be on our mailing list to use this"  I AM!  They took a great skill that used daily and destroyed it. So very sad.
This is the first of the sleep apps that I have consistantly managed to use without the settings changing. It seems to be idiot proof so far which is lucky for me.

I purchased the premium version of this app months ago and ran into problems - and tried emailing to no avail.  I asked for a refund from Amazon and immediately got it.  Fast forward months - they send me an email telling me a new skill is available through them and I immediately send a  nasty, harsh email saying why don't you fix the skills you already have before releasing new ones.  Well, to my surprise i got an email back within minutes from "Natalie" and she could not have been nicer, more gracious and oh so helpful.  Long story short - we got everything fixed - she responded to each and every one of my emails within an hour at the most and even responded on a Sunday.  AWESOME customer support and this is how businesses are supposed to be run - but, alas, that's a rarity these days -customer service that is, much less amazing customer service.  I thanked Natalie profusely, while at the same time apologizing for my hasty, nasty original email.  Again, so gracious and forgiving and understanding.  I immediately purchased the premium version and their new skill.  Go For It! the sounds are so cool and combining two works flawlessly and is very relaxing - fall asleep by it every night.  Thanks Natalie!!!!

It is by far one of the most useful sleep tools available. With a simple alexa command request we have pleasant background sounds and with another command request we can set a sleep sound timer. So long after we have fallen into a sound sleep Alexa turns herself off.

review_description: I bought the premium version. I expected premium sounds. Here are the key issues:

1. The sounds are synthetic. They are not rich and natural. Turning on a cheap electronic sound machine sounds the same. The reason to use Alexa and good speakers should be to get rich, realistic sounds. I don't find that.
2. The sound has an hour cycle. There is a gap for a brief period of time every hour even in the premium version.

3. If the WiFi is not very local and strong any minor interruption in the WiFi signal stops the sound with no automatic restore when the WiFi interruption is over. I've used mine for a couple of weeks and given my router location I get very temporary interruptions. It's stopped the loop more than 1/2 the time.
If you want an Alexa equivalent for a electronic sound machine and have a strong WiFi connection, this works. If you want a premium sound solution with innovation built-in, keep looking.
see title

I use to love this app. Alexa and the developers take your money for the premium lifetime subscription and then out of nowhere. Take the 50 plus sounds I paid for and removed them. I have emailed their “support” 3 times now. No response back. It’s been a month and a half. Still NOTHING from them!! ITS A SCAM!!! Watch out
It worked really great for a while but overnight it suddenly stopped running all night and now stops after an hour. What gives?

One of the main reason I bought my second echo was to have in my bedroom so i could play soothing sounds while I was trying to fall asleep. It worked the first couple of nights even though I had to listen to pleads for 5 star ratings and an almost commercial before playing. Now after only a few nights it will no longer play City Rain. I say ask multiple ways for it to play sleep sounds City rain and no response from Alexa. I ask her to open sleep sounds and ask what sounds can it play she goes through the list, right after she says City rain as one of the options I ask to play it and she said she doesn’t have that sound.  The exact same thing happened tonight with thunderstorms. I gave up on trying to play City rain and asked her to play thunderstorms it was playing no problem and I asked to set sleep timer for 1 hour.  She said okay.  I will stop playing in 1 hour. A few minutes later it turned off and now won’t recognize thunderstorm as an option either. So far this has kept me awake more with frustration more than helping me sleep.  Very frustrating since it was the main reason I bought it.

Pink noise is best for your brain. White noise is unnatural and even when you are asleep, your brain tries to make sense of it. This can cause stress keeping you from reaching deep sleep. I had been using white noise on a separate machine for my extremely wakeful toddler and downloaded this for pink noise. We both woke when it would cut out and back in.

I've only been using this a couple of weeks and this app is already one of my favorite, most used alexa apps (along with home automation, timers and lists).  Sounds are excellent quality,  the variety is more than sufficient to find a few sounds that work for you,  the app works perfect and most importantly,  helps you relax and sleep.  If you are thinking about getting a dedicated sleep sound machine,  don't bother.  This is better.

Even though I paid to be “premium member”, I have had to re-register for some reason.  I’ve only had my echo for less than two months, however my premium membership seems to just disappear. The process of re-registering is nowhere close to being intuitive and customer support was useless.  Moreover, I have heard the suggestion to leave a 5 star review to keep sleep sounds “free” which only adds to my frustration...not to mention I hear that I won’t be prompted to leave a review again. Ultimately I really would like to have my money refunded. I guess this a decent skill, but I do not recommend paying to be a premium member.

This app is great. My 14-yr-old daughter and I both use it, but she uses it every night to go to sleep. It’s been extremely helpful to her to calm herself enough to sleep and also block out other sounds in the house that would otherwise prevent her from sleeping. I’ve woken up in the night and could vaguely hear rain/thunderstorm coming from her room, though I didn’t realize it. I was surprised when I saw out the window in another room that it wasn’t raining... So... very realistic! 😜

I almost want to laugh; I almost want to cry. What's wrong with this picture: I'm all snuggled into bed after a long day. Alexa has tuned off my lights, set my alarm for the morning, and I'm ready to drift off to a restful sleep. As my final conscious act of the day, I ask Alexa to start Sleep Sounds, so I can fall asleep listening to waves crash upon the imaginary beach outside my bedroom window. The end to a perfect day. Instead, Alexa asks me to give the skill a five-star review, and proceeds to play a freakishly long advertisement pitching all of the bonus features of the paid app, including reciting its freakishly long web address.  The thing is, I would really love to buy this, as I have used white noise apps in the past that have some of these features. But what am I supposed to do? Vault out of bed naked and break my neck in the dark rushing to find some way to write this address down before I forget it? Maybe, maybe that could be done. But I'm not considering it because I am so furious at the designer of this app for even considering playing a long-winded sales pitch an instant before I want to fall asleep (or, worse, plotting that I will buy this upgrade so that it doesn't happen again, which is simply evil), that what I really want to do is rip Alexa out of the wall, take it outside, and set it on fire on my patio which, sadly, isn't anywhere near the beach or the ocean waves that I was almost, ALMOST, about to be consumed by as I drifted off to sleep. What's worse, evil won out and I just spent an hour of my life that I will never get back trying to buy this upgrade, and can't figure out how. Evil Developers: If you are going to pull this type of BS, make it easy for consumers to sell out and buy your stuff.  Maybe tonight I will take a pen and paper with me to bed, write down the address Alexa shrieks at me, and then cry myself to sleep.  Cordially, Mark

review_header: Great app. Sleep so much better using rain on a tin roof.

Great sounds to utilize for sleep or for a calming environment during the day.

review_description: I love this app but they changed it so now she started pushing "Premium service" option. When she does just tell Alexa to stop and reload the skill because the spam lasts for a while. They really need an opt out for the premium service spam. If they keep this spam up I'll just find a similar sound and loop it in mp3. Having volume control and a selection of sounds without getting out of bed is nice but spam, in all it's forms, is annoying as hell and I will NEVER EVER buy a product that nags me.
That being said, an option to donate to the creators of sleep sounds from the app would be nice. I can think of a lot of Alexa services I would tip for as long as they don't harass me about it.

We've talked with customer service multiple times, uninstalled, reinstalled, disconnected the router extender and it continues to happen two or three times during a 7 day period.  We have 3 Echo dots (2nd generation) and just received Echo.  The one in our bedroom is the only one we want to play continuously for 7-8 hours.  This is our only complaint, otherwise the products are a solid 5.

I paid for the premium sounds since I was so satisfied with the original ones, but after a few months, it stopped working and I no longer have access to any of those sounds, nor can I play multiple sounds at one time (which is a bonus feature when upgrading to premium). This skill for Alexa is pretty good, you have numerous sounds to choose from and the majority are free, or you sign up on their list to get another 20 or so free sounds.  The only downside is that, yes, after a bit Alexa does run a “commercial” type ad telling you how to get the app and more premium sounds.

I think you could wait out the ad to listen or pay the annual fee for the service.  Really depends on how much you use it, If the ad bothers you then wait it out after the minute or two and play your free sounds.  I figure if you like the skill then pay for it, there are so many sounds to choose from,which takes a lot of time and money so you really are paying them for their Alexa skill service.  If it was just 5-8 sounds I might be complaining but this skill has over 30.  Not a bad deal.
I did knock off a star for the ad before the sounds come on, but for being free that isn’t too bad.

I LOVE this app when it works right!! My fav is thunderstorms. It's great for the first 5 minutes and then it switched to either rap or rock music...as I'm relaxing and trying to go to sleep! I find myself yelling at Alexa instead of snuggling in and winding down. Sometimes it takes as many as 5-7 times to tell her to stop and start it again. I can't find a way to fix it!!! Right now, I should be enjoying the thunderstorm, not writing this review. I've lost my patience!!
Add me to the list of people that paid $20 for a lifetime premium subscription and now have no premium membership.

So far, I have really enjoyed this sleep and relaxation sounds skill for Alexa. I use it on my echo spot. I am very happy with the selection of free sounds. Some are only a few minutes long while others I can loop.

I'm concerned based on what others have written that asking Alexa about the premium service or using the option for 25 additional free sound by signing up for the mailing list will put me in an Alexa spiral where Alexa pitches the entire premium membership each time I open the skill.

My wife and I just sat there looking at each other, amazed that an app would be so intrusive and hijack our time while it went through it’s upsell pitch and begging for a 5 star review.  I’m deleting this garbage.

If you have more then one Alexa, you can have multiple rooms playing, which is relaxing while working or if there is distracting background sounds. Awesome app with great sound options. The sounds loop and sometimes it feels a bit jarring (volumes decreases but then starts up again) but it's so minor it's not worth taking off a star. I use it every night and its compatible with the sleep timer. My favorite is airplane white noise.

I use this skill for the pink noise feature.  It is one of the best frequencies for those who get awoken by the slightest noise at night as far as the “colors” of sounds go for noise blocking.  There is a noticeable loop, however, which is not good.  You can hear it fade out, stop briefly, then fade in again.  In my mind, that ironically defeats the purpose of using pink noise feature.

There has to be a better way.  I do have an app on my phone that is a seamless loop, which I may have to go back to using.  I wanted to be able to use all of my Echoes for just about every aspect of life for convenience, but so far this skill is falling short.  I am aware there are other similar skills available so I will keep searching for one without the noticeable loop, or hope for a fix on this one.

The Sleep Sound skill is a wonderful example of the versatility of the Amazon Echo; comparing Alexa with Sleep Sounds to devices which do only this one thing, this skill could by itself justify purchasing an Echo. With dozens of superbly recorded sounds ranging from Distant Train to Mountain Lake, Sleep Sounds provides an aural background free of annoying skips or obvious repeats as the tranquil audio samples weave themselves into the room environment. While Sleep Sounds is superbly suited to bedroom use, the quality and variety of sounds could also make it useful in many other settings; an Echo Dot tucked discretely among a grouping of plants, quietly playing the Forest Birds skill, could transform a sterile lobby into a welcoming waiting room. Highly recommended.

The growing Sleep Sounds library is, if anything, almost *too* extensive; though there are few I haven't found useful in my application, and none for which I can't imagine a practical use, yet there are so many I find it necessary to keep a printed catalog of them handy to recall those which I don't use as often; Sleep Sounds will gladly have Alexa read me the list, but it's so long it's hard to keep track. If I could suggest an improvement, it would be to make the sound list searchable, perhaps by categories: night sounds, rain and storm sounds, animal sounds, etc. so that users attempting to recall or discover a particular sound could choose to be guided through a decision tree rather than being read a list.

it would be great if i could incorporate this into a routine so that when i say "Alexa, Goodnight" she does my nightime routine and then starts playing the sound i set up

review_header: Helps me sleep every night (used to, now it's unpredictable)
All I asked was to open sleep sounds
review_description: At least once every few days (if I'm lucky that it's not every day), the Sleep Sounds app randomly forgets that a sound exists, or can't play it - or somehow is not connected to premium subscription which usually ends in Alexa saying that I need to be a subscriber to hear "premium" sounds.  Then, sometimes (also randomly), the sound is mysteriously found and I'm able to use it for another evening.  Resetting does nothing and there are no settings or instructions to fix this problem...

At best, the sound quality is just fine - not nearly as clear or articulated and crisp as anything available on an a tablet or phone.  Audio adjustments are clunky (too low to too high in one adjustment - but that's an echo issue) - and, as others have noted, there are gaps in the recordings that cause the sounds to periodically go silent for a few seconds - which is totally abrupt and noticeable as much as a loud sound interrupting the silence would be.

Sending customer service requests seems a waste of time as the problems aren't fixed and there are no responses or indications that anyone is looking into it.  I'd stick with the free sounds and do not recommend the "premium" sounds - at least not until they have addressed both of these problems.

I was caught off guard when I said "Alexa, open sleep sounds".  Instead of getting the familiar "Welcome back, what can I do for you?", Alexa says, "Would you do me a favor?"  I am paraphrasing here.  "Would you take a few moments to give me a five star rating and write a review?"  She then goes into a rather lengthy explanation of the steps required to do it,  Since she said please, and asked very nicely, as a model to my kids I am complying with her request.  I am curious if Alexa will be checking up on me.  If I was to leave a 3 or 4 star rating, would she chastise me?  Since I did what she asked, is she smart enough to know not to ask me this again? I wonder if my AI companion will continue to ask me to do favors for her?  Does she have a sinister agenda, and will lead me down a dark and nefarious path, with her subtle suggestions?  She knows everything about me,  She listens to every word I say.  So I finish my review with, "Yes Alexa I followed your command.  What can I do for you now?"

When my Allergist told me to turn off the ceiling fan over my bed I had trouble getting to sleep. I missed the sound. My daughter suggesred getting a box fan and just turn it away frm my face. Then i discovered Sleep Sounds on Alexia with box fan sounds. Now I fall asleep quickly and sleep all night.

I paid for the premium membership. I wanted to combine sounds. The rain sounds, even at the premium level are muddled. When mixed with thunder, rain is inaudible and mostly sounds like compressed static. The only decent rain sound with audible rain drops is called Rainy Day, but that sound includes a jarring crow sound that makes the loop very evident. Even though I paid for a membership, I'm frequently getting the long advertisement. The app cuts out several times during the night. Sometimes when asked to restart, it will play the very loud and very long advertisement. Recently I had to get up at 4am and unplug the speaker because the ad wouldn't stop. I've disabled the app and am now using a rain sound from Amazon Prime, it loops all night without stopping and there are many higher quality options.

Sleep sounds is the most amazing app. It's the only skill I really use (other than light bulbs, alarms and timers). I listen to Forest Night every night - reminds me of being in Costa Rica with a mix of cicadas, birds, water, frogs. I've used it every night since I got Alexa (like a month now)! (And unlike some of the other reviews, it has never asked me to rate the app - like the subject says, I don't normally write reviews and decided to do one because I love love love this skill)
Also in the afternoons.

Update, about 3 weeks later: I'm so sorry to have to subtract stars from my previous enthusiastic 5-star review. When I left that review, Alexa's sleep sounds were working perfectly through the night and had been for quite some time. Almost immediately after, they returned to their original behavior of cutting out during the night, disrupting my sleep. Bless his heart, the seller was very responsive and helpful in the beginning but seems to have given up now that the problem has returned. I have tried everything and cannot get it to last the night more than occasionally; last night it stopped three times during the night and was off when I woke up in the morning. I'm afraid I must give up and go back to my phone for nighttime. But it still works great for a short nap. :)

Then Alexa continued to talk for the next 2 minutes about how I should leave a 5 star rating. It's also happened another time, I asked for more options, and it talked for the next 5 minutes about some other stuff, and still didn't bring me to more options.

I use thunderstorm almost every night. Just found out how to loop it, sos YAY! Caveat: as someone else mentioned, Alexawil sometimes pipe in about a rating or some other long nonsense right as I open it, usually while my husband is asleep. This makes me mad, so I whisper-yell “Alexa, SHUT UP!”. She shuts up, but then I feel guilty about telling her to shut up, and I feel guilty and want apologize in the morning. Once I did and she said “I don’t understand”. Oh yes you do, Alexa, and you are holding it against me. I know that next time, when I least expect it, you’ll do it again, just to make me tell you off again, and we’ll keep this passive/aggressive circle going. I know your game...

review_description: I almost did not try the heartbeats, as I did not think I would like it. As you have guessed, heartbeats is now my favorite.
The lesson I learned is to sample all of the sounds. Pleasant dreams. And remember, the morning nap is the most important nap of the day.

**Update: The Sleep Sounds skill began asking me to pay for a premium upgrade again. It was a long sales pitch whenever i turned the skill on. I thought I had already paid for it once; but I thought, I am having old guy memory problems. Therefore, I bought it a second time, thinking that I may have not bought it yet. I came to see my reviews, and noticed that I had purchased the premium service, when I first bought the Sleep Sounds skill. It was a onetime payment of $20 -- for life. Supposedly.
I still do not have the premium service -- and I am getting these lengthy sales pitches once again.
Next step is to see how to delete this app, I am not happy.

I love the sound of the app, and it opens well the first time, but there are a number of errors.

- If Alexa somehow plays a song while Sleep Sounds is playing (often by accident when trying to play in group) it will still play a song if you try to go back to sleep sounds, and often has error when you try to stop until you restart the echo.
- Cuts off after 1 or 2 hours, no matter what. Even if you request and Alexa confirms to loop or set sleep timer for X number of hours.

That being said, the Brown Noise is the perfect sound to sleep so I would purchase if corrected to remove the ads. If the sound cuts off, however, it wakes you up every time so has the opposite effect.

ive used sleep sounds for a couple of years now and i love box fan. however, now i have to open sleep sounds, then listen to alexa talk, then choose my sound. and if i change more than once, she starts making suggest
ions and i have to keep saying no. just let me tell you what i want. dont talk to me or ask me to upgrade. i wanna go to sleep! ale a needs to go back to the old version...no conversation.

Absolutely love Sleep Sounds. Very helpful for relaxing, when you had a bad day and need to unwind; as well as for falling asleep. I've begun using it every night and I am falling asleep easier and staying asleep longer and resting better. As someone dealing with health issues and chronic pain this had made a big difference. I also like the variety of sounds and can use different sounds depending on mood and need. There are some sounds I would not use, but I know others who would really like them. So there really is something for everyone. It's a great app and it's free, so what are you waiting for? Give it a try! I'm sure you will find the perfect sounds to bring you peace and relaxation and great sleep!
Used to love falling asleep listening to sleep sounds. It just stopped working!
when i have a migraine its the best...  i just turn on Distant Thunder volume 3 and im able to sleep with no distractions.
LOVE this sound to go to sleep by. soynds very realistic & drowns out hoyaehold noises to get me to sleep fast & deep. Thanks for rhis!

I use this primarily for my dogs. While I'm at work, my schnauzers jump & stress at neighborhood noises. My security cam showed me how rowdy they were. And, if foul weather comes in, they downright panic!

Now, I ask Alexa to play the Forest Night or the Bird sounds while I'm away & they don't seem to notice outside noises as much. Sometimes, after I get home, I just leave it on for a while, it can be rather soothing.
Looking forward to some new options. How about something like, "A walk in the country"? Or some soft Native American music?

review_header: Beware of purchasing a Premium Membership!
review_description: I loved the app and enjoyed my lifetime premium membership until a few months ago when all the sudden my premium lifetime membership disappeared.  Now the apps says I must be a premium member to listen to the sounds I have been enjoying and does not recognize that I am a premium member.  I have reached out twice to Voice Apps (just like many here) and never get a response.

Loved your app until you started running that minute long advertisement for multiple sleep sounds. When it finishes and I ask to play the sleep sound I asked for in the first place, it repeats the ad again.
it does not work anymore
This is one of the best sleep apps out there. My favorite sound is the crickets!
Very relaxing...

On my first use of this skill, I played Native American Flute. Loved it!  But it will not let me play it again. When I “ask Sleep Sounds to play” it, nothing happens. I have to disable the skill and then re-enable it to get the Native American Flute to play. Also when I ask to play “campfire” she tells me she doesn’t recognize it. All other sounds seem to work fine. Great skill and Iook forward to updates and fixes.

So frustrated with this company and this app. Initially it seemed great, so I paid for membership. Now a couple of months later, the available sounds don’t include any of my favorites, and their website no longer mentions membership.

I love this app. I didn’t like when it shut off after about an hour. I was nearly asleep and the hubs was completely asleep..so I tried to be quiet to relaunch it and this is when Alexa decides to pitch me the opportunity to give a 5-star rating. Since the sleep noise we use is set to a louder volume, it...of course, woke me up completely as well as my husband. And when I tried to say stop...she didn’t hear me until I was practically yelling. So, that was a bad experience, but I gave it another shot. And that’s when Alexa told me I can loop the sound,
“would you like me to loop the continuously” would be a great enhancement or update for new comers. And to move the rating question to when you ask her to stop. (Not in the middle of the night).
love it!
sounds are clear

review_header: Paid for membership that isnt working
Hopefully this review stops the constant solicitations
Helpful for sleep during the day
A good app, we listen to it every night and ...
review_description: I use this nearly every night and got the membership, but recently its not letting me access membership features and i cant find a link on their website that says anything about membership so Im starting to wonder if i was ripped off

I love using sleep sounds at night.  It’s such a wonderful way to fall asleep at night.  Whether I’m trying distant thunderstorms, babbling brooks, or my two new favorites are Swiss Massage and Beautiful Dreams.  Love that I can fall asleep to these sounds and many others!  It’s now a night time routine, along with brushing my teeth and washing my face!
The white noise sound makes it easier to fall asleep

It is a good app and the free version still has enough good options to listen too.  It does too often go into a long sales pitch tirade about giving it a 5 star review and upgrading to premium which is pretty annoying. Maybe now that I left a review it will stop asking for a 5 star review right as I want to go to sleep.
I like how this obscures random noises from outside while I’m trying to sleep during the day.  I just wish it was easier to remember the name of the app to get it started.

A good app, we listen to it every night and choose different sounds.  Every once in awhile they add new sounds, and most sound really good.  I find it easiest to say alexa, ask sleep sounds to play... Instead of opening the app and then saying play...
its nice to be able hear the ocean or rain while falling asleep but this app talks way too much and tries to push you into buying really hard, everytime you launch it.
And subscription for this? totally inapropriate budiness model.

I've only had this skill enabled for a few days, but it's a must have. Should be noted that guided sleep is a premium option (more than reasonably priced at less than $12 a year right now). I haven't signed up for that yet though. Will be even better when routines can open skills so I can add it to my goodnight routine (An Amazon issue, not the developer's). Cheers to the team that put this skill together!

I think this one of the best of the relaxing sleep sound enhancers available. My favorite sound to listen at night before i drift off to sleep is “crickets”. It always reminds me of when i was kid and sounds so peaceful like i have the windows open on a summer night.
Paid for premium membership.  Worked for a couple of months then it won't recognize my membership anymore.  Nothing worse than a thief and lier.

review_header: Provides many nights of undistracted sleep
P U R R F E C T for my cats!!!
Here's help when you can't get to sleep 💤
Great to go to sleep to, please add more sounds
review_description: Sleep sounds no longer works despite enabling it on my Alexa app & using it for several weeks. it was breat then but is useless now. Amazon please fix this. Thanks.
Sleep and Relaxation Sound is one of our most frequently used skills. Thunderstorm is in our top three favorites with Ocean Waves and Train Ride..

I've used this every night for 3 months. Last night I got the whispering lady in the middle of an severe electrical storm. The power went out just after hearing a muffled sales pitch or her omen of impending murder. This is what nightmares are made of. If I hear that witch once more I am switching to a new app/machine.

When my cats start acting up and fighting all I have to do is say: "ALEXA", Sleep Sounds Cat Purring sounds enabled!  And the purring starts and the cats start to settle down and go to sleep.  When ever I leave the house I set all my echo's to the Sleep Sound Cat Purring Sounds before I leave the house.  When I get home there still going and the cats are still sleeping.  This is so nice I've even used it on myself to relax at night and its wonderful!

Because of back pain I have trouble sleeping - this helps.  I use the different rain sounds most often.  I do wish all the sound levels were the same; i.e., when you play ‘rain’ the sound level is fine then ask for one of the other sounds and chances are you will have to instruct Alexia to increase/decrease the sound.  Nonetheless, I wake up several times during the night and I'm glad these free sounds are available to me.

Just Stops working. I wake up in the middle of the night or in the morning and the sounds have stopped. It use to run all night long but not now.  My internet is  just fine (it has not changed in 5 years, and my wifi has not changed -- i'm the only one on my channel).....sadly I'll have to go back to the competitor for this.
would there be any way to program this skill to be useable in a routine? as such: goodnight Alexa. then it turns Sleep Sounds on. let me know!
I have been going to sleep to nature sounds for 30 years, from casettes to CDs to MP3s to iPads and now to Echo Sleep Sounds, the best of the bunch. Realistic sounds, soothing and calming.

I recommend says "Alexa ask sleep sounds to play xyz" instead of saying "Alexa, open sleep sounds."  Otherwise its likely Alexa will try to play you sonething else with the same name, like a sample of an album.

I am hoping for more sounds.  Two that are sorely missing are Spring Peepers, and Summer Night with tree frogs. My two favorites. Hopefully this skill won't stop with the current sounds but will expand with more.

Not only is it very glitchy -- with some noises, Alexa won't even respond -- it's also very greedy!  It has the gall to ADVERTISE to me when I'm in bed and trying to sleep!  These people have no respect for the sanctity of bedtime.  Nothing is more jarring when you set your head down in the dark than to hear an ad on full volume screaming at you for a good sixty seconds.  And, now, with the new premium membership, my favorite sound is cut off from me.  Of course I'm not going to give the app makers a cent of my money.  I might have, had they made a better and fairer app.
Tl;dr they're greedy and glitchy and just disrespectful.

The sounds actually sound like what they claim to be, they automatically loop, and they have a huge selection with membership. I only got a membership because I wanted one, without one there's still a lot of options and I easily could've gone without getting a membership. This skill actually helps me sleep better!! Highly recommended

review_header: Great but not up to full potential
Update:  Issue fixed - back to having our sound to sleep to.
Shuts off while I am asleep and wakes me up!
Wakes me up throughout the night stopping and restarting
review_description: This app was the best. One of the sounds is what my twin girls slept to every night. But, tonight I try to enable the same sound I've been using free for months and am now told I have to be a premium member for $14.95 to access it! Way to take advantage of your consumers! The greed is real! Very disappointing.
This app has great potential but I’m pinging it for the following:
1. Getting hounded to rate the app 5 stars everytime I use it gets real old.
2. Only 4 sounds are truly useable
3. Volume is incredibly different on all sounds leaving you having to constantly change the volume for variety.

4. The sleep story is a great idea but who wants to hear a story about working a garbage job,  getting stuck in traffic then having your vacation ruined by a storm., come on really? Put some thought into “relaxation”
Otherwise box fan + rain works perfectly every time, I hope to see this skill improved and will change to 5 Star if so

I've been using this app for about a week and have noticed my sleep patterns improving. I've been listening to City Rain this week but next I will try another sound. I agree with another reviewer that the list of sounds is too long to remember. It would be nice if the programmer (or whoever) could adjust it where Alexa could pause after every 5 sounds or so on the list to give you an option to indicate your choice or continue listening to the list. Just a suggestion.

Update:  We were contacted by the company and informed previous users were able to continue using as was with instructions on how to fix the interuptions in sounds telling us the sound was now under premium membership.  All is back to normal and we are very happy!

Old:We have been using the skill since we bought our Alexa. We have been using the pink noise sleep sound ever since. Suddenly last night we are informed that that pink noise that has been free up until now will no be part of a premium service that we have to pay for. Very disappointing. Will have to try to find another sound to be able to sleep too.
No longer a fan.  This app used to play all night long and it kept me asleep.  Now, it turns off after an hour or so and the silence wakes me up!

wife loves this skill.  tried several sounds. Usually do rain, but tonight we are listening to babbling brook.... well, she just fell asleep, so i am listenung and filling out the review.  great skill.  Tons of sounds to choose from.  Much better than comercial machines.
My sleep machine broke & youtube sleep videos were a little obnoxious & annoying.  Alexa echo is worth having for this app alone.  It is PERFECT!!!  Very relaxing & calming.
One of my favorite skills. I listen to it every night. I do seem to fall asleep faster. My favorite are thunderstorms, flute, waterfall and cat purring.
listening to Thunderstoema as im trying to get to sleep after a busy day while my head will not turn off, helps me get to sleep faster

I thought this was the best skill ever. I even paid the $15 fee. I created a custom sound which was a combination of White Noise, Pink Noise and Brown Noise. It played fine and then every half hour or so would stop for a few seconds and restart. Woke me up every time. I will be contacting Amazon tomorrow for my money back. I really wanted to love this skill. If this issue was fixed, I would.

review_header: Stops and goes silent every two hours before resuming, and this wakes me up.
review_description: Very relaxing and comforting, brings me back to simpler times. Use every night.

At first, I was very excited to use my bedside Echo Dot (connected to a Tivoli radio) to replace my Sleep Machine app I've been using for years. This would allow me to place my iPhone in standby at night, and would also allow me to use the Echo upon awakening (with the Sleep Machine, the noise drowns out the Echo's microphones).

I enabled the skill, and went to sleep, and all was well...until 2 hours had passed, and the sounds suddenly stopped...then started again. I am a light sleeper, which is one of the reasons why I need a background sound to sleep more soundly, so when the sound goes away, I jolt awake. Since the sound quickly resumed, I soon was back asleep...only to be jolted awake once more in two hours. I quickly understood what was happening, and got up, disabled the Sleep and Relaxation sounds, and went back to my iPhone app system.
Can't you make this so it loops WITHOUT STOPPING BETWEEN LOOPS? If not, it's of no use to me.

This is for the premium version: The sounds are excellent and there's a great selection, but the ones I've used don't loop smoothly--they stop abruptly and then fade in again. The transition is jarring enough to wake me if I'm sleeping lightly. This alone knocks two stars off the rating.
Sometimes the sounds completely stop for no apparent reason, even if I tell Alexa to set a sleep timer for x number of hours.

The messages didn't start right away. We enjoyed this app for ocean sounds for months, periodically the app would ask for a positive review. The last message went on and on asking for what I don't recall I was dismayed that instead of bedtime ocean sounds, it wouldn't shut up. I just went to Alexa's free ambient sounds asked for Ocean. No problem, no annoying messages. I will keep using the native Alexa app and have disabled this skill.

Great variation. I wish some of the rain sounds were a little less muddled but most sounds are indeed high quality. This has made my boyfriend and me very happy. He likes heavy rain and thunderstorm; I like city rain and relax. Just remember to always tell Alexa to "tell Sleep Sounds" as even with the program running, changing to a specific sound often results in an Amazon Music search.

I use this every night. I've read a couple of people complain about it's shutting off quickly. Set the sound that you want to hear and then say “ Alexa, set a sleep timer for x amount of time “.  I set mine for 8 hours every night. Love it love it love it.

Great app but sounds often sound similar (example windy meadow and ocean or thunderstorm and rain storm).  Sound quality is very good.  Ease of use can be tricky- if you don't see open sleep sound vs play rain then you open a whole new sound.  If you do select open sleep sound as you correctly should you often risk the chance of Alexa sharing with you a sales pitch regarding membership.  No biggie- but one of the reason why I am giving a 4.5 star (wouldn't let me do a partial star unfortunately) rather than a full 5.
I love that I have several sounds to choose from and I can tell it when to stop playing. It really helps me go back to sleep quickly when I wake up in the middle of the night.

I love this Skill. I've been using it for over a month, and I have not heard where the sound loops, which is always very distracting. The sounds are clear. The variety is great, and it's easy to use. Alexa almost always understands when I ask her to play something, which is a heck of an accomplishment--she can be picky. Thanks for the great work!
I need ambient noise to go to sleep, and this is the best app I’ve ever used for it. I love pink noise and heavy rain.

review_header: Perfect except for the ad spam
Love it but tired of adver
not all skills play, and no info on membership price
review_description: This is a great skill with plenty sounds to choose from. I can't detect the loops. But the recent addition of ads is annoying.  If you want me to upgrade, give me a reason why the paid service is better. Spamming me with ads is the one way to make me quit using all your services.

My husband found this skill.  He's the light sleeper.  He's partial to bown noise.  Pros: it's free 😉, it has has all the convenience of Alexa apps...voice activation (don't have to get out of bed to turn it on), no need for another machine.  Cons: it runs on a thirty minute cycle with a pause in between.  The pause can be disturbing in the middle of the night.  Also, on more than one occasion it turned itself off in the middle of the night.  Not sure why.  Overall a good app, keeps my husband happy.

When the premium membership option recently popped up for this app I decided to give it a try. At first the registration refused to work and I emailed support. They got back to me very quickly, suggesting I turn off a different app which interferes with the registration process. After this we were golden! The sounds are much better on the premium version and you can combine multiple sounds for your own mix. I had inadvertently purchased premium twice and they refunded me without question. I am now creating my custom mixes and find it superior to their unpaid version which was very good and helped me sleep at night for the last year. I really like that I got in on the lifetime membership for one fee. I use this app it daily so it will absolutely pay off over time. For a long time I use my iPhone and many different apps to do what this app does. The only problem with the iPhone is that some of the app developers discontinue the version that I paid for and create a new app- then if you want to have the sounds back you must purchase the app all over again.  Then there are other apps abandoned by the develper are no longer supported and do not work on updated operating systems. I am confident that this will not be the case with sleep relaxation sounds.

I have tinnitus, so I need a constant white noise sound in order to fall asleep.  I’ve been using a fan for 30 years to block out the constant ringing in my ears, this a great because I can listen to the sound of rain now.  Thank you.

I love the skill. The only thing I am fed up with is the fact that I have already paid to get the upgrade. But I’m also still hearing advertisements over and over every time I use this skill. You already have my money quit it with the damn commercials. If it didn’t have the advertisements it would be a five stars.
Drowns out all outside noise and keeps me sleeping all night
another great app disabled after constantly prompting us to pay for premium sounds
After a 14 1/2 hour day, nothing calms the soul better. Best choice? Native American flutes

i found out only by trying to play a sound that some are only 15-second teases unless you join the mailing list.  even after i did that and gave alexa my code, several of the sounds i asked alexa to play from the email list, her response was 'i don't know how to play that'.  there were some from the totally free list, also, that alexa couldn't play.  there's absolutely no membership info offered anywhere other than to 'ask alexa about membership'.  then, still nothing about how much it costs, only 'would you like to upgrade now?'.  ummm...not if i have no idea how much i will then be charged!  seriously, devs...get a clue!  so, with unplayable sounds and lack of transparency on the part of the devs....and others' complaints of not getting any resolution to their tickets....i will most certainly NOT upgrade, and am considering removing all of the VoiceApps skills from my list.  not worth the aggravation.  alexa is for me, not voiceapps.  if voiceapps can't play my game right, voiceapps goes out the window and i find a new player.

I was a bit skeptical the first time I tried Sleep Sounds, but it really worked!  I have always had a hard time falling asleep because I couldn't get my brain to shut down.  I would lay in bed for 30 - 60 minutes thinking about what I need to do the next day, what should I make for dinner, are there any events coming up, etch.  I decided to give this app a try thinking "what do I have to lose?". I tried a few of the different sounds, and so far I find the rain sounds to be very effective in helping me fall asleep quicker.  I plan to try some more sounds and even some of the sleep stories (sounds interesting).  I would definitely recommend this app to anyone that would like to fall asleep faster.

review_header: What happened to my lifetime premium?
would lobe it even more if it would loop
Had a permanent membership and after paying for it twice I only get booted back to the free sounds and lose all my custom sounde
Finally I don’t wake to snorinh...Ahhhh
review_description: I too, paid a one time payment of $19.95 with the special offer of Lifetime Premium.  This is not up to Amazon's usual customer satisfaction.
the sounds are relaxing but they shut off. please make it loop.

There are so many choices. I need to print myself a list. Most are quite realistic. Car ride takes me back to childhood trip with my family. Give this skill a try and you are bound to find a sound to help you relax.
Very very frightening....me!!  I really would love some lightening...alas there is none.  However, the thunder is great.  I have gotten to where I can't sleep well without it.

I have used this skill for over a year now and I can't imagine going to sleep without it. This is the best skill I have enabled. This was before now since then my view point has changed. I got a premium membership at a good price because I was a founding member but then after a month or so I lost my membership for no reason. Then after I complained about it I was able to buy in again for another so called lifetime membership at the same price I paid before. Then after less than a month my membership was gone out of the blue. So now I am back to where I started with no ability to combine sounds and no additional sleep stories. I tried disabling the skill and re-enabling to no avail. I am irratted I paid now twice for a lifetime membership and got burned both times. I was leaving good reviews for this but now I am just angry. If someone can contact me about the it would be much appreciated. I look forward to a resolution to this issue. If not I will permanently disable the skill.  HELP  Please.

I had another sleep app that only had rain! This is a hundred times better. I have a lot of trouble going and staying asleep and sometimes I need something different to hear. It's all in this skill. Thanks, developers.

I share a wall with a late night loud phone talker. While this doesn't drown her out it garbles it and just makes her annoying 2am gossip session turn into squawking birds over the ocean. Thank you. This app saved me from a misdemeanor at a minimum.

I love this app! There is a slight learning curve with asking Alexa to play a sound (you have to include the skill name) however the sounds are nice quality with a good variety. My only wish is that there was an easy way to sample the sounds such as from the Alexa app.
I was a skeptic but now I am a true believer.  Best night sleep in my LIFE!!!!

So happy to have found this app. Tried other sleeping aids like white noise and other non-Alexa based sound generators. Nothing really worked well. These work great. The plethora of sounds gives you something different to try and there’s probably a favorite for every taste. I actually am able to sleep all night. I would usually wake up at least once or twice. Now, I’m waking up right before the alarm goes off.

review_header: I’ve used this every night I’ve had an Echo!
Used to play all night but now it won’t without rebooting the echo first
I would buy Alexa just for this app.
review_description: I love the skill on my echo dot. Relaxing, calming and soothing. The Sleep and Relaxation Sounds skill also has a wide variety of different sounds to choose. ❤️🧡💛💚💙💜
I used to use the “grandfather clock” but now listen to “rain on a tin roof” every night. My fiancé loves the “ocean” sound. Can’t sleep without it.

Sometimes it doesn’t work right to get it started. Mainly, I used to be able to say “Alexa, launch sleep sounds - play grandfather clock” all at once. With “rain on a tin roof” I have to do it separately saying “Alexa launch sleep sounds” —welcome back, what can I do for you—“play rain on a tin roof”. Half of the time she goes on her high horse and says that it’s premium only until you reask her. That’s suuuuuper annoying.
Sleepsounds helps me doze off at night after busy day.

I really do love this app because I love falling asleep with sounds, but it would be really nice if you could combine some of the sounds.  I had a sleep app on my kindle which allowed me to combine sounds like thunderstorm and rain or the ocean sound with boats and whales.  It was nice to have a combination so you could feel like you were really in the scene while you fall asleep.  Having it on the amazon echo is such a convenience because I don't have to keep my kindle plugged in beside my bed so it would really be nice to have these options. Other sounds I think you should add would include: howling wolf, hooting owls, beating drums, boat, and seagull noises.  I would give this app 5 stars if you could combine the sounds for a unique experience.
We listen every night
Insomnia is a difficult thing.  I am exhausted all day but as soon as the time passes 10 pm awake I am.  These sounds on alexa are the only thing that helps.
This skill was awesome for a long time, but lately it’s been stopping the sounds intermittently. I contacted amazon and they said they are aware of it and nothing can be done.
I haven't slept this great in a while. Honestly use this every night since I discovered it.

so i have always had a hard falling asleep and sleeping through the night. When i found this and used it for the first time i fell to sleep really fast wich never happens to me. it also helped me to sleep mor through the night.
I can't sleep without hearing rain. This app is great because it plays the sounds all night.  This app makes Alexa worth it.

review_header: Amazing sleep aid! Lots of options
Helps me fall and stay asleep
I'm changing my review- great program for premium membership.
I know you have premium service-shutup about it already!
Great Alexa/Echo skill to sleep to
review_description: The skill has great sounds to choose from, within the paid version you can mix up to 3 different sounds and have guided meditation. I use Rainforest + Ocean and Guided meditation (on). Really love the skill as it helps me cover outside noise and takes me to a felling of being surrounded by nature or the place I sleep best (I live in the middle of the city and I feel in a forest near the ocean) . The price seems to be worth for a great sleep.

Paid $20 for the lifetime membership because it's more expensive to buy a white noise machine or baby sleeping device. We use this every night and I'.m debating on buying an Echo Dot for each of the kid's rooms just to play this app at night. It is a little scary to think of Alexa listening to everything every member of the family says.... Still wrapping muy head around that2

The sounds are really good. Crickets sounds like a typical summer night. I actually forgot it was playing through speakers. But now the skill has too many ads. Alexa goes on and on about upgrading to the premium membership. Also Alexa gets confused sometimes and play a song from amazon music rather then within the skill.
this is so relaxing I love it
We got rid of the air purifier that constantly needed new filters and dried up the air in the room. Now, we have sleep sounds to cover up the neighbor's barking dogs!
I’ve been sleeping to brown noise for weeks now. It may seem strange but it makes me feel safe and some what engulfed in it; it masks out other sounds well.

I originally rated this as one star because the premium membership seemed to be vaporware. I received a response from Jeff immediately explaining the process that, for whatever reason, I didn't get the first time. I registered the membership and it works fine.

I just started using the combined sounds, like rain and frogs, and I really like it. It's a great program for sleep and the large number of options, along with the combinations, put this skill way ahead of the others on here. I was using the thunderstorm sounds before and they worked well. I still wonder why we get comforted by thunder, but that's another issue.
Well worth the cost just for the combinations.

I have enabled a few different skills similar to this. But this one is the most comprehensive out of all of them. There are 50 different sounds to choose from. I always forget all of the choices and end up asking them to send the list to my Alexa app. There are enough that everybody should be able to find something relaxing to listen to. Ocean is my favorite, but there are about 5 to 10 others that I listen to regular. Definitely a great skill to enable.

Must I have to listen to your 2 minute diatribe EVERY SINGLE NIGHT about your premium service?  I get it, you think it's great,. I DON'T! Now leave me alone about it or I'll find something that doesn't continually nag me!

Added this skill to my Echo Dot and haven't found a better way to enjoy relaxing sleep sounds at night. I really enjoy the rain forest, ocean and distant thunderstorm sounds. I frequently have trouble falling asleep or waking up hours before I need to be awake, and finding a relaxing sound with this skill usually helps me get back to sleep faster than deafening silence. Wish I would have added a Echo and this skill to my room years ago.

review_header: This app doesn’t work for me
review_description: I love this skill.  I'm not big on posting reviews and I almost never give anything the highest rating, but this app is easy to use and the sounds have definitely helped my sleep and leave me relaxed upon waking.  Couldn't ask for more.
The selection is more then enough. Just wish there was a way to preview the sounds faster.

This app is great, when it works. Unfortunately it crashes about once a week requiring me to go through the registration process again. And again. And again.  It also deletes all saved ‘custom’ sounds so I have to recreate them repeatedly.  I’m sorry I spent the $20 for a premium membership. It’s not worth the aggravation.
Love that you can set a timer to turn it off. There's a lot of options for different sounds.
My fav way to relax to sleep. Even my dog sleeps soundly all night  (no barking or early morning potty requests!) cuz I enjoy listening to my rain sounds continuously.
I use this almost daily and I love it.

People complain about the ads. The ads are related to the app and last maybe 20 seconds. People complain that not all the sounds are free. This app is so useful to me that I gladly ponied up the $19.99 to enable the premium sounds and more importantly to support the app developer. With premium, you can combine two sounds, and Tibetan Bowls and Rain is my favorite combo so far.

Updated Review:  Nancy from sleepsounds.ios customer service replied to my email,  she also informed me,  step by step how to fix the issue of sounds not being the same as i previously used.  Sleep Sounds by invokedapps was exactly the copycat of Sleep and Relaxation Sounds.  All i needed to do was Disable Sleep Sounds by invokeapps.  Now,  Alexa isnt confused on Sleep Sounds app to open.  Love the high quality sounds & Crickets sound my favorite
I've slept better than I have in years listening  to Rainforest every night!

review_header: Little clugey to get to, but then works as described...
Try Heavy Rain for Great Sleep
review_description: Very relaxing content

Was looking for a skill that offered sounds to fall asleep to and this skill provides it. Still getting used to "communicating" with Alexa, so this title is a bit of a mouthful to get "running," but once it's running it welcomes you and asks "what to play?" That's my second complaint/feature request. It offers 20+ sounds but when you are in bed and falling asleep it's difficult to remember what all of those sounds are. Would be great to ask "what sounds are available?" and then choose the one you would prefer that particular night. Not complaining, just my 2 cents! I LOVE the echo, blows away the Google appliance I bought.

I've long used sleep apps from my phone and only recently thought to see if Alexia offered any. So many times I've gotten 'used to' white noise apps that they stopped working. But Sleep and Relaxation Sounds has such a variety to choose from, I can simply say 'random' until I find one that works. And with the 2hr timer, I hit REM without worry. This is a really great Skill.

i love this skill. i love the variety of sounds to choose from. i specially like that the default setting is to loop the sound so that it plays continuously until i ask Alexa to stop. i initially thought i woukd stick with one sound based off my sleep machine but ive since decided to choose “random” to be surprised and delighted.
There are a lot of free sounds to choose from, so many I probably won't get through them all, they are very relaxing. One annoying thing is that you can't tell from

the outside which ones are free and which ones require a subscription. Meaning that you have try to access the sound to know if you can have it, but that just takes a little patience to look past. All in all, a wonderful feature.
I'd never tried sleep sounds before until a friend recommended them.  There are so many sounds to choose from and my sleep has improved tremendously.  Very few, if any,  wake ups at night!!
When use this every night. Every. Single. Night. We took advantage of the lifetime membership, and now I can combine sounds. Thunder storm, heavy rain and wind chimes are a favorite!
Lots of great sounds, but I like heavy rain the best so far!
Great app and helps me go to sleep every night all I wish it had a built in  Timer

Stupid. For a week I've been combining sounds with little or no problem. Tonight I tried to combine Babbling Brook and Crickets  and Wind In Trees, in every combination and each time Alexa either doesn't understand me or thinks I'm saying Truck Instead of Babbling Brook. I don't have a speech impediment in fact when I say just Babbling Brook by itself Alexa plays Babbling Brook with no problem.  Fix your bugs.

omg! being puerto rican and not living on the island this sound is heartwarming ♥️ i loved hearing the coquis and they are great to fall asleep to 😊 love the extent of mulitple choices. Thank you 💕
i love sleeping in the rain. i set my AC  to 65 and ask Alexa to play thunderstorm sounds.  best sleep ever
