All I wanted was some rain sound at midnight to get the baby back to sleep, but instead was subjected to almost a minute of sales pitch that could not be stopped. Combined with the already poor sound mix necessitating the need for the volume to be at max to even hear the sounds at a reasonable level, this resulted in Alexa essentially shouting nonsense at us, including the website address letter by letter. Can’t trust the skill anymore so have moved on.

Thanks for having your sounds play on a continuous loop! Also the variety of sounds! Please add More. All the other sound skills pale in comparison to this skill. Thank you,  thank you,  thank you for doing this right!!

I am a bad sleeper.  This app has helped me get more sleep.  One problem I have with this skill is that I cannot start it on my Echo the way description says to.  They say "Alexa, Open Sleep Sounds,  Play Distant Train".  That does not work for me.  I have to say Alexa, "In Skills", Open ....,  Play .....  If I don't say In Skills first,  it either doesn't do anything, or plays some music that I did not request.  I can live with this as it helps me sleep, but the description for the skill should give correct instructions for use.
It's nice if you can find a sound, but good luck.

Alexa believes that "I'm really enjoying them" and if I'd like to keep them free, I should rate it 5 stars. I feel manipulated a bit. I don't give anything 5 stars without a reach around but I'll go 3 stars all day long and 4 stars for the thunder and rain storms. The Ocean Villa story is cute as well but I think Alexa can get a bit over zealous at times as far as my level of enjoyment. I also understand that someone needs to be compensated for pulling this collection together, but Prime isn't free, the Echo Dot wasn't free and now I'm being trolled to elevate my membership to yet another tier to enjoy even more content. I dunno ... it's good and I'll recommend checking them out but I "wince" at the constant more more more that's so prevalent everywhere in our society today.

Last night was first night with 8 week old Golden Retriever puppy and sterting crate training over night. After  crying  non stop tried Alexa and white noise- either this skill/app us magic, my puppy is brilliant or I am simply a genius! No matter which- it meant 2 hours of sleep - at least until the next scheduled potty alarm!

This is a wonderful addition to my skills list!  I love all the different sounds.  So far, thunderstorm is my favorite, but I'll have to try a different one each night to figure out which one helps me sleep the best.

They took the best of the best and made them into a sound loop that will play till you tell it to stop. Normally I would have to Alexa to play Thunderstorms from my music list at least 2 or 3 times before everyone was asleep. My family loves this new feature. I can here our Echos going with different sound from the children’s bedrooms.
love all of the sound options. helps us sleep at night.
What can I say, it is the perfect sleeping sound app.  Tons of great sleeping sounds for free.  We use it in our nursery every night.

I paid to upgrade to the premium app. Unfortunately, my experience was not as fluid and worry - free as I would have liked. After two days of trying to my Echo to acknowledge my premium status, I was about to give up. The developer was quick to respond to my query and after a couple of emails I was officially subscribed. I am now using the skill and enjoying it immensely. It was a little frustrating given the cost, but the developer's quick reply and support won me over.
This really relaxes me before bedtime!!
it was good, had tons of free sounds to pick from.  Now when you ask Alexa to open sleep sounds she cant open “Super sleep sounds” thats not what i said and this is the only sleep skill enabled.
sounds like the real deal - love it❣️

The only issue that I have is that regularly Alexa wants to give me a 40 second speech detailing all of the options available and the possible upgrades. This would be fine, except often it’s late at night when I go to bed and my husband is already asleep, or I’ll wake up in the night and realize I forgot to turn on Sleep Sounds and Alexa wants to have a loud, long conversation, which wakes up the entire house.
It would be nice if I could just say “Sleep Sounds, play rain” and that’s what it would do. No need for Alexa to even answer.

When I listen to the relaxation sounds or the beautiful dreams sounds, I have no trouble falling to sleeping because these sounds truly do put your body in that relaxed mode and make it easy for you to drif off and get some💤.

Love it
so relaxing and calming

review_header: Love that they keep adding sounds and stories
Just make a playlist of soundscapes.
review_description: I started trying this app when I was having some trouble sleeping.  I really liked it so I sprung for the premium sounds.  I'm glad I did.  I love being able to make my own combined sounds from those available.  I also love the stories.  I wish they had a few more.  I usually chose a sound and loop it all night.  There are a few that don't loop or I forget to ask them to loop.  I highly recommend this to all who like nice sounds to fall asleep with.
I absolutely cannot sleep well with out listening to this now!!

The product is ok, the sounds are kind of redundant with short tracks that loop. You have to pay to get the best sounds. Also, they say you can get 25 extra sounds for free by signing up for their mailing list, i have tried to do that multiple times and have never got it to work. You're better off just downloading soundscapes and putting it into a playlist to listen on loop.

Fantastic!  I look forward to sleep with white noise.  And, it works.  I fall asleep faster and I believe I sleep better.  On those nights my mind just won't shut off, white noise is there to plow away all those often random thoughts or worries and I get to sleep.  And stay asleep.  This beats tossing and turning any day.  I'd recommend this to anyone to use all the time or just on those nights when sleep just won't come.  Works for me.
we listen to rain, waterfall and jungle almost every single night. it really helps us fall asleep and stay asleep.

I have to admit, much to the dismay of my wife that I am a lover of "white-noise". That being the case, for years it was necessary that I leave the TV on to receive the needed effect. When we put a large ceiling fan up it served its purpose quite well. Ever searching for something new to try, I stumbled upon this app after setting up our Alexa Dots in several bedrooms. Wow what choices! Want to be reminded of your trip to the ocean? Try ocean sounds. How about your camping trip to the forest? Try out forest sounds! Oh yea, and if you really want generic white noise, its there as well...
Love it, still needing to test out all the sounds, but this is a great skill

Because I saw a few warnings to review the skill or lose it (which I don't think is fair to ask), I figured I'd review it. I have only tried a few sounds, but still like the skill overall. The Thunderstorm was a bit too loud for me, so I'll try distant thunder next time. I really liked Ocean, and Rain too. Great for relaxation and bedtime.
Love it!

I do like this skill for the Echo and Echo Dot. The end of the loops are extremely noticeable, so if you’re not asleep when it completes its loop, it’ll wake you up with how abruptly the sound ends. Overall it’s acceptable, and there are some decent sounds from which to choose.

I figured why not try it because I have tried everything else. Sleep Sounds is just the thing--it drowns out the snoring with natural sounds  that help me relax. I like Thunderstorm, but there are many different ones. I use it every night.

I have to unplug and reboot my Spot to stop the sounds.

very good

If you do not remember LOOP ON wording literally, there is absolutely no other way to tell Alexa to endlessly loop a sound. it takes an intelligent person just few more seconds to embed in algorithm more word variations of LOOP ON in order to cover over 80% of variability in how people could ask this of Alexa.

This skill has allowed me to ween myself off Ambien. Naturally relaxing sounds that help me fall asleep faster and get more restful sleep.
i would buy alexa just for this. thank you! it always helps me sleep faster and more deeply. i love the variety and ease.

I've been using Sleep Sounds for months now, alternating between several different ones like Beautiful Dream, Fireplace, and my most recent favorite, Native American Flute. I used to get frequently woken up by anxiety attacks in the night, but since I started using this, they're now far and few in between. It also helps my animals calm down in the night, too! I use it while working at my desk during the day as well, and makes for excellent background noise when music is too distracting! I've never had an issue with the sound quality, and setting it up with a sleep timer is easy so I don't miss my alarm in the morning for work. I haven't gotten the premium feature yet, but looking forward to it in the near future!

This is the best sleep sound app I have found so far.  It has many different sounds to help relax and assist you in falling asleep.  If you don't know or remember what they are, just ask Alexa; pick one and don't forget to set the sleep timer.  Alexa remembers and turns off the sound at your selected time.

It was good, now it advertises at you when you want it to play a sound while most of the sounds I used to listen to for free are now locked behind a paywall. Disabled and will use Prime Music for ambient sounds from now on.

By the way, you can ask Alexa to turn on repeat to prevent it from stopping in the middle of the night. I use that in conjunction with "Alexa, set sleep timer for X hours." This way it will repeat the ambient sound and still stop playing after a certain time (like when it's time to get up.)

review_header: Far Superior to Other Similar Services!

These sleep sounds are fantastic. I always sleep with a fan, in the summer for coolness but in the winter too for the soothing, constant sound. Recently I decided to try Alexa Sleep Sounds instead and have been delighted. Easy to get going, they stay on all night, and the ones I've tried are immensely soothing, especially Babbling Brook and Brown Noise, but you will probably find ones you like different from or in addition to these.
helps with falling and staying asleep.

Update 3: Finally got some tech support and got the thing working. Even with the trouble, it's a 5-star app!

I have been having some problems getting to sleep for some time.  Since I have been using Sleep and Relaxation Sounds within 15 minutes I'm off to dreamland.  I wish it had a turn off after a selected amount of time. However, it is easy to tell Alexa to stop once I wake up the next morning.
I have difficulty staying asleep and am finding this very helpful.  Love train ride!
helps me fall back to sleep throught the night.
This skill has helped me sleep through the night!

review_header: Drifting off to a soothing sound....
Pretty good for a free skill!
A great night's sleep every time!
Love the sounds and especially like the auto looping
review_description: Like, you can actually listen to womb sounds while you sleep! The app store a great job of drowning out small obnoxious sounds that wake you up through the night. We sleep more sound and wake up much more refreshed since we started listening to sleep sounds. We even take Alexa on every trip we have wifi (including campgrounds) for the perfect night's rest. Huge fans! Oscillating even!

Loveeeee this! We use this nightly. Distant Thunder, Evening Rainforest, Gentle ocean waves.....are 3 of our top favorites! It's great because I just set the sleep timer and drift off to the sounds of nature! I sleep better with this then I did, before we began using it! Try it!

Still learning my Echo Dot but love this Skill! Sometimes I feel as though Alexa doesn't understand me and gives me more info than I need - she tells me about the Skill AGAIN even though I know about it, wants to list the sounds, etc. Could be user error, but in the event it is not, I'll give it 4 stars versus 5. Otherwise, this is a great substitute for a sound machine. I set the sleep timer for 3 hours and we are set! Rain on a tent is our favorite.

I fall asleep every night to Ocean Sounds.  Very lovely sound.  The only thing I don't like is having to review it and give it a 5-star rating to enjoy it "for free", according to Alexa last night.  I hope the Alexa feature won't start charging for each and every little thing!

I have had many pieces of technology with sleep sounds. The problem is that they are generally tinny, and the loop is Crap. I am on my fifth sound and it's perfect so far. The looping is clean, the sound is even, and it's not coming through a tin can. Love it

I use this App every night, as I am habitually terrible at getting to sleep. This app is an integral part of my new sleep routine, and I now fall asleep within 10 to 20 minutes of getting in to bed and starting the App. My go-to sleep sound is Ocean, works every time!
I love this app! The sounds included are great, with more added all the time. I especially appreciate that they loop automatically, so the sound won't stop just as you are about to drift off.
Alexa will play the sound you request when you start the skill, she will tell you all the sounds if you ask, and you can hear them all by saying next.
It plays and asks for a review and then nothing happens!

Constantly trying to sell me on writing reviews, upgrading, etc.  Endless chatterbox with each launch. Made me want to bash Echo Dot with a sledge hammer because it would not shut up.  Deleted this “skill”.

Two star rating for inconsistent performance and fee for premium skill plug.
A wonderful app that helps you relax and sleep!

Many different relaxings sounds to choose from. I have had insomnia most of my life and this app has help me tremendously! I grew up in a very rainy & thunderstorm state so that particular sound is comforting!

The sound quality is great, but there are many times they ask you to buy the premium feature. It wouldn’t really be a problem if they wouldn’t do it when I ask for sleep sounds in a whispering voice. Kind of defeats the whole purpose of the skill (relaxation)

review_header: Great sounds that relax me and helps mmm e sleep

A Alexa skill for true relaxation when it counts.
review_description: I typically choose a sound that is not very complex and tell Alexa to stop at 20 minutes, but 30 might be reasonable as well. some of the sounds I prefer are Native American flute, piano dream, distant thunderstorms, ocean waves, rain, and Wendy trees.
This is so well designed and easy to use, and the sounds are so good. I especially enjoy the stories, like ocean villa (which ends in relaxing rain sounds). Such a peaceful way to fall asleep.
Great sounds that relax me and helps mmm e sleep. Went to the website and found that you can bypass the intro by asking Alexa to just have sleep sounds play ....

I'm sorry and I hate to be THAT guy but some of these sounds sound like a radio trying to pick up signal. They're not high quality and or they aren't good for sleeping. Some are jarring. Listen to rain on tent (which is premium lol) it sounds like your FM can't find a channel.
Good app you don't have to keep telling it to Loop it goes automatically loops and you can tell when you stop

I think this is an awesome app. I have tried several sound apps but this is by and far THE BEST!! There are so many choices! You can set it  to turn off at any given period of time.  The sounds are so realistic as opposed to some I have tried that you could not tell a waterfall from popcorn popping!  I go to sleep every night to one of these sounds. With the Premium I can combine up to three sounds for a custom sound  I am looking forward to the playlist option that is coming soon.  Customer service for this app is excellent. I had questions about it and they took care of my issue with expertise and were not only knowledgable but very accommodating.  This is THE BEST relaxation and sound app out there!

A fun Alexa skill that puts your mind and body at ease. The many sounds gives you a choice as to your mood before sleep. If you missing the sound of rain, Sleep sounds is there for you. i love this skill it has helped me sleep soundly from the 1st use

Overall I like the skill. In fact, I liked it enough to subscribe. So, I kinda feel ripped off about having paid for something that doesn't work. That said, I continue to use it for the individual sounds but will not renew my subscription when the time comes.
So many great high quality sounds to choose from! Everyone in my family has a favorite they like to go to sleep to. (I guess I will be getting my kids Echo Dots for Christmas!) A really great skill!

Still love this app! There were some connectivity issues with the pro version for a long while, but they have been resolved and everything is working perfectly again! They have also added some nice new features like guided meditation that you can play on top of your favorite sounds. Very nice!

I have had this skill since Oct. 2017. I paid for the premium sounds then. I started having trouble getting Alexa to play them. I wrote to the company today and a woman there wrote me back with help in half an hour.
I don’t know what problems others are having, but I am very pleased with this company as well as these Sleep Sounds.
One thing that may help some people: not all the sounds play to sample on my iPhone. I don’t know why. But they do play when I ask Alexa so I’m fine with it.
I’d printed the sound list last fall & marked favorites. With new sounds I’ll do that again.
Sleep Sounds has the best sounds, quality and quantity, of any app I’ve seen. It helps me immensely.

I've started listening to sleep sounds after I get in bed, instead of falling asleep to late-night talk shows or crime drama reruns. I select a sound and then usually set a sleep timer for 30 or 60 minutes. It's so much more relaxing than the TV. I haven't tried all the different sounds yet. Didn't care for the "pink noise", but do like the ocean and some of the other nature sounds a lot. I don't think I would pay for premium access — certainly not without the ability to preview the sounds.

So I almost purchased an alarm for my son and a nature sound machine for my husband and I. I had one Echo, so I just moved it into our room and bought another for my son's room and saved space and $20!! And I have way more sounds in the Echo than some best reviewed sound machines!! A++++
it is like magic to be able to enjoy nature sounds at a voice command . can be addictive...

I have a very stressful job and I'm a very light sleeper with two small dogs who wake me constantly... I look for everything I can to help me sleep more peacefully and this did the trick! I wake up several times a night still but I wake to the most relaxing sounds and it lulls me right back to sleep... Worth it!

5 stars, just because Alexa asked so nicely. Not really.  I keep going back to this skill almost every night. When I just can't shut my mind off at the end of a busy day, I can ask Alexa to open sleep sounds, and then flip through the various sounds until I relax, and fall sleep. This one skill is worth the cost of Alexa in and of itself.
was previously  paying for "white noise" app subscription  . hoping this one does the same job for free.

review_header: Buyer beware!!! Lifetime purchase doesnt equal lifetime

review_description: We have pets (who don't understand night time is for sleeping) and live in a semi-urban area. This skill is great for drowning out background noise and helping us stay asleep. It's really nice that it plays until you tell it to stop, opposed to other skills you need to keep restarting in the middle of the night because they time out. Really like that there are multiple sounds in one skill.
great variety of great sound loops. this is the best skill, hands down, for many different relaxing sounds. great work.

I use my favorite sleep sound of certain familiar tunes played in "Music Box" style. These wonderful tunes actually put me and my three cats to sleep every night. Thanks for bring back those sweet sounds that most of us as babies grew up listening to at night. Remember those little music boxes that hung over our heads playing sweet tunes as we slept in our cribs or bassinets. I appreciate this very much.
The waterfall is so soothing! It calms me down, helps me sleep, and all my worries away! My dad has lymphoma cancer, so I feel like lying awake all night. (This is Amanda's child).

seriously ... it works ! many choices.  they are quality sounds.  use it most every night

We use this every single night. It plays on our speaker of choice in our adjoining bedrooms we share w/ our toddler. We personally use "box fan" for our sleeping sound of choice. I am currently becoming a certified yoga instructor, this app will be so helpful in setting just the right atmosphere for my classes. They continue adding more sounds selections too.... our whole family just loves it! We also love the sleep timer feature, so that it turns off automatically when it's time for us to wake up... & the timer will be helpful in my yoga classes! Too cool! 👍🏽👍🏽 Great job creators!

"Alexa open sleep sounds and play Loons."
SCREEEEEEEEEEEEE!!
*Sigh* Seriously, can anyone fall asleep to the terrifying sound of loons?

While the range of sounds available is good, there are a few issues. In one recording, blizzard sounds, there is an intermittent beep, which can be disruptive. The loop doesn't always work. And the looooong message to leave a review is extremely annoying at 2am. Overall, it's okay, but needs some work.

So many wonderful sleep and relaxation  sounds. I have  been using for 45 days and have yet to listen to them all. Very realistic and helps me fall and keep asleep. Many times I have woken up thinking it’s raining  out to realize its just my rain sleep sounds !!!

review_header: Nice selections of sounds to fit my mood
Fall asleep to it every night
review_description: Supposedly you get 25 mote sounds for joining the mailing list.  I signed up and, well, that didn’t hsppen.  Campfire is listed as an included sound and, well, that’s a lie.  It plays for 15 seconds and then Alexa tells me its only for premium membership.  Not going premium when the two things you tell me dont happen.

Sleep sounds has a nice variety of sounds so I can find the right one for my mood.,  Babbling brook is one of my go tos.  Some of the sounds, like rain on tent, are a little fast for me to fall asleep to, but that’s  my nuance.  For the beginners, you have to say “stop” to stop the sounds.  I did not read the instructions when I started and kept asking Alexa to turn off sounds, similar to the commands I use when listening to music on other apps/skills.

Listening to "Train Ride" reminds me of a favorite Hitchcock film, "The Lady Vanishes". The films main setting takes place on a train where a female character vanishes under suspicious circumstances. It feels as though you really are on a train ride and are a passenger with a "cat bird seat" view. Every night I play this sleep sound and I envision myself on a train ride that takes me away -- almost vanishing in to sleep.

This skill set is an amazing skill set for Alexa; adding sleep sounds helps allieviate anxiety and provide the mind with constant white noise to facilitate a good nights rest. One good feature to point out is that the sound plays continuously until you request it to stop -- no time limit as with YouTube.
Please keep supporting this app and let the creators know this skill set is a wonderful addition in the aid for mental tranquility.
when the app is opened, and asked to play a sound listed here as free, I receive a message that it is only available to premium members. Ridiculous to list them as free, them charge for them.

This skill was good in the beginning, now it turns into an annoying and full of commercial. Crap skill.
Loved it when sounds were free... too bad that on top of my Amazon Prime fee, I have to pay for Echo apps.

My wife loaded this skill the first night she got her Echo and amazingly slept until 10 AM the next morning. This was the first time she slept through the night in years. It was easy to use and worked great. Even more amazing was that Amazon "messed up" looping and when I emailed the developer he replied in less than 30 minutes and by that evening had put in a patch! Great response and great customer support (they could have waited for Amazon to fix their problems but worked around it themselves) .
There are a lot of great sounds, but the one we keep coming back to is Brown Noise. It’s a steady HVAC type of sound that puts me right to sleep.
...is one of THE best sounds to sleep to! Love Sleep Sounds!

review_header: So incredible, I’ve been looking for an app without
review_description: I’ve been using the airplane sound for about a week. There’s a sound in the background that I find annoying but if I turn the volume down I can tolerate it. When I fly I always choose a window seat on the wing. I love the sound of the engines and I wish the sleep sound was more like it but it will do.

Some of the sounds make it nearly impossible to stop the app. I was trying to hear each sound to determine which one I liked. Half of the sounds made it extremely difficult to stop, one of them took multiple attempts over several minutes standing right next to the unit. Disabling seeming I can't turn it off easily from voice or from the phone app.
, I’ve been looking for an app with sounds that doesn’t cost a first born child and here it is just ask away, they even have cicadas,
I love a distant train, glad I'm not the only one!
Once I figured out some shortcuts it was easy to use... love ‘Forest Night’ the most.

I love the sounds. My only complaint about this app is that when it plays, I have to scream "Alexa!" multiple times in order to get Alexa to wake up. That doesn't happen with other apps, not sure why it does with this one. It bothers me because when I wake up during the night and want to turn the sound off it can be very hard to do and then I find myself wide awake.
Wish it were easier to switch sounds.

I really like this skill especially when I can get it to understand me. Sometimrs it doesn't understand and tell you something about a song instead of  playing a sound. My favorite is babbling Brook. This helps me go to sleep so fast and easy

Fantastic. So great for afternoon nap and works exceptionally well as I get up fairly early in the morning and my wife sleeps a bit longer. I can mess around downstairs and sleep sounds totally drown me out

fairly lifelike

use it every night!

I wish I hadn't spent money on a white noise machine less than a year ago now that I have the Amazon Dot. I don't need it, one less thing in the bedroom. I love it, it is so easy to use this skill.
Liked the free version, but quality of sounds poor as they were over compressed (Some are entirely broken (such as Distant Thunderstorm)).

I was intrigued by the Premium version as it offered HQ sounds and after writing to the devs about a few issues I had seen I was pleased at the support they gave, so I decided it was worth the upgrade, even if only to improve the quality of the effects.

But weeks on, the broken sounds are still there (even on their website), and there is no evidence of "HQ Sounds". Worse still, the devs no longer reply to my mails, so I feel duped as I can see no benifits (other than getting rid of the ads) of upgrading.
All I want is to play some soothing sounds but the app keeps talking about premium upgrades and asking me to rate the app

Premium membership had some difficulty registering, but like magic, it registered. Lots of sounds. The music is fantastic. Some sounds are annoying, but overall, I love this app. Trying to figure out how to have multiple sounds at once, though. I've got a question submitted to support
So nice to fall asleep to. When I first
hear the crash of waves on the beach my whole body relaxes.

I’ve been using a noise sample in Amazon music to go to sleep, but I kept having trouble with the stability of the app on my iPod or the reliability of the Bluetooth.  Now with this skill I no longer need the iPod and the Bluetooth speaker works much better with my dot.  For me the best sound to sleep by is pink noise, and the sample in this app is just right.  I would have given it 5 stars but it annoys me that I have to remember this set of unique phrases to turn the skill on and play the sound I want.  I wish there was a “verbal hot key” ability in Alexa.  I know I probably shouldn’t ding the app for this, but I am.  To sum up - If you give this skill a try, you won’t be disappointed, and you will sleep easier.
Having Alexa's Sleep Sounds Skill has maxe it easier to get to sleep when I really need to. I have found rthe perfect "white noise" for me and it is much better than just the fan in my room.

So, I’ve read their description a handful of times. Despite listing campfire in the free sounds section, after listening for thirty seconds or so it tells me that it is a premium sound and I will have to buy it.  Look, I get a developer needing to make money from an app, but I cannot abide being lied to about the features.
Wonderful sounds for deep and peaceful sleep. Highly recommend!

review_header: Great for people who have trouble falling asleep
review_description: I used to listen to Native American Flute but now they moved it to the Premium Sounds that require payment???  I'll find a similar skill somewhere else.
love listing to this at bed time

Works great… Just tell Alexa to set the sleep timer for an hour, or however long you wanted to play. People have commented that the command "stop in one hour"  doesn't work, and Alexa stops immediately. She's probably just not understanding you and only catching the word stop. Instead, say "Alexa,  set a sleep timer for one hour" and viola!

I have had trouble falling asleep for a while now. I have tried everything from medication to essential oil, but they really didn't work or gave me back side effects. So when I saw this skill in the Alexa app, I had to try it and man did it help me. Now I can relax and listen to almost any sound I want and I am asleep before I now it. You should really try this skill out.

We have been using this skill for months in our master. We now have a 1 month old and it’s perfect for keeping the baby asleep if we need to get up in the middle of the night. A recent complaint is that it seems to have had an update that sets a timer. I woke up, the last two mornings, and the skill had stopped playing, when it would previously play until I told Alexa to turn it off. I would like to find out how to keep it running so that our baby isn’t woken up by the silence.

The heavy rain sound helps me fall asleep most nights. The sound is very effective even though it sounds more like white noise coming from my Dot. One thing I don’t like about the app is that periodically the volume of the sound slowly decreases to nothing and then rises back to the volume it was set to. The odd changes in volume often disturbs my sleep.

I'd love give this a higher review however I can not. The skill occasionally stops for no apparent reason. More often, after an hour or so it will stop, go to silence and then start again for no reason. On the positive side I do enjoy the variety and quality of the sounds available.

Our only complaints, lately it’s been quitting in the middle of the night before we wake up, otherwise, very nice, we rarely sleep with the fan on anymore which means cheaper electric bill!!

It has been nice to find an app that has so many different sounds to choose from. So far it has been easy to use and it stays on the whole night. My kids have really enjoyed having this available to them.

literally my only problem with this skill is that the sound loops have an abrupt finish/ start transition. they worked do better if they'd face out and then back in st the end of the loop. more noticeable on some, but an issue on many.

use it for white noise every night! Hopefully by leaving this review, this Echo wont ask anymore. that is the only downfall of this skill.

The very reason this exists is to play all night.  Even the command to run continuously  doesnt work.  Huge let down.  I even purchased thr premium.  By the way the premium sounds list..half arent on it still.

Sleep Sounds is an extra welcome on nights that I have difficulty falling asleep quickly & I simply love this Alexa skill.

use it nightly to help me fall asleep.

review_header: Drowns out the neighbor kid living in his car

review_description: The sounds to choose from are a great selection. My two favorite are City Rain and Ocean, though I keep finding others that surprise me. The sounds all loop well, and the amount of audio within each loop is extensive. This is one of the better ambient noise applications I have discovered for Alexa.
I love Sleep Sounds. On a hot night when we have the bedroom window open, a nice thunderstorm really drowns out the rap music we hear coming from the car the neighbor kid is sleeping in.
An excellent skill for my Alexa that truly helps me crash at night. A great selection of sounds with more added, apparently, on a regular basis. So far this is my favorite ambient sleep helper.

review_header: Stop trying to soothe me to sleep with your annoying messages requesting a 5 star review! This behavior seems to have stopped.
My most used skill on my Echo
review_description: Love this app.

As others have said, this was a better app before they started asking for 5 star reviews. I've gone back to my manual Electrofan, which does not annoy me with unwanted pleas. Last night as I was getting ready to go to bed, I once again got the request for a 5 star review, then it proceeded to play a sleep sound other than the one I requested. Hey guys, fix your bugs and stop begging for good reviews. At least offer an opt out option to be left in peace. By the way, I did pay for the upgrade and now I'm not so glad I did that.

I am updating this review after returning to the app a few months later. I've used it for 2 weeks now and it has not repeated any of the behaviors that caused me to give it a 1 star review. I'm upgrading the review to 4 stars. Of course, as soon as I hear another sales pitch when I want to go to sleep, I'll knock it down to 1 star again.
In the process of moving, we had two places and my sleep machine was never in the right location. When Alexa obtained this skill, it was perfect for me. Love it.

My daughter is going to sleep earlier and faster (previously took 2+ hours to fall asleep with the radio—the cd reader broke). But “Beautiful Dreamer” is good option too.

review_header: I like it, but maybe not for long...
Love it, perfect for all night!
review_description: This is a great addition to Alexa and I've been trying it out for the past week. The main problem I've had so far (and the reason for only 4 stars instead of 5) is that it locks up frequently and Alexa won't take any more commands until I turn it off and start it over. At first I can interrupt to ask what time it is or give commands for more or less volume, play a different sound, tell it to "stop" etc. but after a couple of commands, Alexa ignores me no matter what I say. Then I have to get out of bed and physically turn the unit off and restart it which is very frustrating if I'm trying to relax.
I’ve emailed about this, but it randomly stops playing during the night. Meaning I have to start it over again. This is after paying for premium membership.

About an hour later it did it again, then switched to the vacuum sound. Still no history of any corresponding request in Alexa app.  Maybe Alexa is telling us she needs a vacation and a maid... I've been using the free sounds for awhile now and decided to try the upgrade. It didn't go well. I set everything up and got a "congratulations" screen from the app, but when I tried to activate any of the premium features, Alexa told me I had to be a premium member to use them. I contacted the developer and although the chat window didn't give me an immediate response (the ".IO" indicates they're on the other side of the planet, in India), I did get responses to both the chat window and email overnight. The instructions they first provided didn't work, I let them know, and they gave me a 2nd set of instructions that did. I'm now able to play premium sounds and, more importantly, able to combine sounds (wind chimes & bird songs for a garden setting -- A+).
As far as some of their previously free sounds now being available only via the upgrade, I'm OK with that. These folks deserve to get some money for the work they've done.

And for anyone wanting to know what sounds are available (there's a standard set, a set via Premium upgrade, and a set for giving them your email address), go to their website for the lists (most of which you can sample).
